fields.title: Polish Mead Masters  Competition 2024
fields.description:
Welcome to the only such mead competition in the world.

This competition is oganized by  Dziki Miód Meadery Poland and is open to any amateur and commercial meadmaker.

The only categories for this competition are Dwójniak,Trójniak and Miód Pitny Sto┼éowy.

No BJCP categories will be accepted. There will be no first, second and third places, the  best meads in a category will win a a title of Master of Polish Meads.

We will have two titles. Master for wining in one category, Grand Master for three categories.

Would you like to see your name on the bottle of mead made by Dziki Miód Meadery in Poland? No problem, you just need to win the Master title, share your recipe with Krzysztof Piwowar and if only your mead is possible to be produced in Poland you will receive a few bottles of your commercially made mead.

We ask for ONE bottle of mead, at least 12 oz/375ml. There is a limit of 5 entries.

All mailed entries must be received at the mailing location by the shipping deadline - please allow for shipping time.

All entries must be handcrafted products.

The competition organizers are not responsible for entries, are not received by the entry deadline or entries that arrived damaged, entry fee will not be refunded in such cases.

Qualified judging of all entries is the primary goal of our event. Judges will be well known Polish home and commercial meadmakers.

There is a limit of 5 entries per entrant.

Bottles will not be returned to entrants.

The entry fee is $15 per entry.

Please, don't mention alcohol/mead competition when sending your parcels, the best is to declare juice or liquid yeast. You can write FREE SAMPLES NOT FOR RESALE on parcels.

For parcels from USA with 1 bottle we advise to declare value of $15 - max $35 when sending more. PLEASE mark it GIFT FOR A RECIPIENT, we would like to avoid duty fees.

fields.description:
Miód pitny sto┼éowy.

this category is not a traditional Polish mead, it is between Pi─àtak and Czwórniak. We want to receive a mead, which is dry and with about 12% ABV, so it should be started at about 21-22 Brix or 1,088-1,092.
fields.description_pl: Miód pitny sto┼éowy to nasza nowa propozycja,  chcemy dosta─ç od Was miody wytrawne, odpowiedniki win sto┼éowych, góra 2 Blg. Prawdziwy czwórniak obj─Öto┼¢ciowy ma startowe 25-26 Blg, mo┼╝e by─ç wytrawny, ale jest wtedy bardzo alkoholowy i niezbyt z tego powodu pijalny, zw┼éaszcza par─Ö miesi─Öcy po fermentacji. Nasz miód pitny sto┼éowy to odpowiednik czwórniaka komercyjnego, nastawianego z 21-22Blg. Taki miód ma parametry wina sto┼éowego, przy 12-13 % alkoholu.

fields.name: Tr├│jniak
fields.extra_info_hint: Description of mead: ingredients, honey variety
fields.extra_info_hint_pl: Opis miodu pitnego : sk┼éadniki, rodzaj miodu pszczelego
fields.description:
Trójniak
Polish meads are described by ratios. Using these ratios, we can calculate starting Brix,
Trójniak is 1 part by volume of honey and 2 parts by volume of water. (Ratio 1:2)
1 liter of honey weighs 1.4 kilo (and is about 80% sugar), so it gives 1.12 kilo of sugar in a 3.4-kilo mixture. (112 / 3.4 = 33 Brix) (Specific Gravity = 1.144)
From our books, the most described range for a Trójniak is 32 - 37 Brix. For our competition, I suggest that you start from about 32 Brix for both traditionals and melomels. Our goal during fermentation is to reach 14% ABV, so the final Brix should be about 8 Brix - 9 Brix. When fermentation stops lower, you should stabilize and backsweeten to 8 – 9 Brix for proper sweetness.
Starting Brix: 32 SG: 1.139
Final Brix: 8-9 FG: 1.032-1,036

fields.name: Dw├│jniak wagowy
fields.extra_info_hint: Description of mead: ingredients, honey variety
fields.extra_info_hint_pl: opis miodu pitnego, sk┼éadniki, mi├│d pszczeli, proces
fields.description:
Dwójniak by weight.
Dwójniak is 1 part by volume of honey and 1 part by volume of water. (Ratio 1:1)
1 liter of honey weighs 1.4 kilo (and is about 80% sugar), so it gives 1.12 kilo of sugar in a 2.4-kilo mixture. (112 / 2.4 = 47 Brix) (Specific Gravity = 1.22)
From our books, the most described range for a Dwójniak is 45 - 53 Brix. Fermenting a Dwójniak from such high Brix to at least 15% ABV is almost impossible, even with step feeding. This is the reason why our commercial meaderies make Dwójniak from Trójniak, back sweetened and fortified.
My solution for this problem is Dwójniak by weigh, not by volume, 1 kilo of honey and 1 kilo of water gives 40 Brix. Using a bayanus type of yeast (my favorite is Uvaferm 43), it’s not a problem to finish fermentation in the range 15Brix - 18 Brix, even without step feeding. You should start all Dwójniaks from about 40 Brix, both traditionals and melomels.
Starting Brix: 40 SG:1.179
Final Brix: 15-18 FG:1.061-1,074
fields.description_pl:
Dwójniak wagowy.

Na nasz konkurs prosimy o nadsy┼éanie dwójniaków wagowych robionych z 40Blg, taki miód mo┼╝na odfermentowa─ç do 15-18 Blg i osi─àgn─à─ç przyzwoity poziom alkoholu. Nie chcemy pi─ç prawdziwych dwójniaków z 47Blg, nieodfermentowanych i maj─àcych finalnie ok.30Blg, to s─à paskudne ulepy.
